header.title: ProcureData Ecosystem Guide
header.subtitle: Technical and commercial manual for users, partners and integrators of the sovereign data platform.

vision.title: 1. General Vision
vision.description: PROCUREDATA is the definitive infrastructure for the data economy. We transform B2B information exchange (slow, insecure and manual) into an instant Transactional Marketplace.
vision.quote: "We don't sell data. We sell the legal, technical and financial certainty that the data can be used."

roles.title: 2. Business Logic: The Triangle of Trust
roles.description: The platform orchestrates three fundamental actors in each transaction:

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Intellectual owner. Defines the price and ODRL rules. E.g.: Iberdrola Data Hub.

holder.title: Holder
holder.description: Technical infrastructure. Stores and serves bits via API. E.g.: AWS S3.

consumer.title: Consumer
consumer.description: Acquirer. Pays and signs the usage license. E.g.: NovaTech Solutions.

marketplace.title: A. Marketplace & Storefront
marketplace.description: A visual catalog with advanced filters. Allows discovering "Green Data" (Sustainable) and verified (KYB) assets.
items: Data Sandbox: Real preview of 5-10 rows of data before purchase.
Bundles: Purchase of multi-sectoral data packages.

dealRoom.title: B. Negotiation Room
dealRoom.description: B2B contracts require dialogue. The Deal Room allows chatting, sending counter-offers and modifying the Smart Contract in real-time before signing.

business.title: 4. Monetization
business.description: The system supports multiple economic models configurable by the seller:
models: One-time Payment: Perpetual purchase of the dataset.
Subscription: Recurring access (Monthly/Annual) to live data streams.
Platform Fee: ProcureData retains a % of each transaction.
Freemium: Free basic data with paid premium options.

tech.description: Built on a modern and scalable stack:
tech.note: Integrations ready for Gaia-X via EDC connectors and support for enterprise Webhooks.
